settings.args.description:
Arguments passed to `gaplint` for linting `gap` and `gaptst` files. Each argument should be provided as a separate string in the array. 
 Examples:  
- `"gaplint.args": ["--config-file=<file>"]` 
 - `"gaplint.args": ["--disable=W014", "--columns=120"]`
settings.cwd.description: Sets the current working directory used to lint `gap` or `gaptst` files with `gaplint`. By default, it uses the root directory of the workspace `${workspaceFolder}`. You can set it to `${fileDirname}` to use the parent folder of the file being linted as the working directory for gaplint.
settings.severity.description:
Mapping of `gaplint` message types to VS Code's diagnostic severity levels as displayed in the Problems window. You can also use it to override specific gaplint error codes. 
 Example:</br> `{"error": "Error", "warning": "Warning", "W014": "Error", "align-assignments": "Information"}`
settings.lintOnChange.description: Enable linting `gap` and `gaplint` files with `gaplint` as you type. Note: Not yet implemented.
settings.path.description:
Path or command to be used by the extension to lint `gap` and `gaptst` files with `gaplint`. Accepts an array of a single or multiple strings. If passing a command, each argument should be provided as a separate string in the array. If set to `["gaplint"]`, it will use the version of `gaplint` available in the `PATH` environment variable. Note: Using this option may slowdown linting. 
Examples: 
- `["~/global_env/gaplint"]` 
- `["conda", "run", "-n", "lint_env", "python", "-m", "gaplint"]` 
- `["gaplint"]`
settings.ignorePatterns.description: Configure [glob patterns](https://docs.python.org/3/library/fnmatch.html) as supported by the fnmatch Python library to exclude files or folders from being linted with gaplint.
settings.importStrategy.description: Defines which `gaplint` binary to be used to lint `gap` and `gaptst` files. When set to `useBundled`, the extension will use the `gaplint` binary that is shipped with the extension. When set to `fromEnvironment`, the extension will attempt to use the `gaplint` binary and all dependencies that are available in the currently selected environment. Note: If the extension can't find a valid `gaplint` binary in the selected environment, it will fallback to using the `gaplint` binary that is shipped with the extension The `gaplint.path` setting may also be ignored when this setting is set to `fromEnvironment`.
settings.importStrategy.useBundled.descr: Always use the bundled version of `gaplint` shipped with the extension.
Use `gaplint` from the selected environment. If the extension fails to find a valid `gaplint` binary, it will fallback to using the bundled version of `gaplint`.
settings.interpreter.description: Path to a Python executable or a command that will be used to launch the `gaplint` server and any subprocess. Accepts an array of a single or multiple strings.  When set to `[]`, the extension will use the path to the selected Python interpreter. If passing a command, each argument should be provided as a separate string in the array.
settings.showNotifications.description: Controls when notifications are shown by this extension.  Accepted values are `onError`, `onWarning`, `always` and `off`.
settings.showNotifications.off.descripti: Never display a notification. Any errors or warning are still available in the logs.
settings.showNotifications.onWarning.des: Show notifications for errors and warnings.
